Comments_List: I developed deeper insights into the research of the faculty in BQBS track.
Presentation skills and all the new topics
seminars about faculties' research, getting familiar with what they study
This gave me a chance to hear about what different professors are working on which was helpful for choosing a rotation.
The seminars allowed us to gain insight to labs at the university.
I learned about various research going on in the MBB department.
I think having three meetings that are shorter would be better than the two long ones.
I dont know what exactly the goal of this course was.
I hope there could be more seminars, and the PIs could make more detailed introductions of their research.
Need more sessions. Two is not enough for us to know all the exciting topics
It was a lot of information in a very short period of time. I felt that this would have been helpful prior to choosing our first rotation or broken up into smaller chunks.
The 5 minute flash talks are a perfect way to present the labs that are available for rotation students.

Strengths: Talks limited to 5 mins, many different professors talk about their research. It's helpful to know which professors are actively seeking grad students.

Weaknesses: Might be a bit better to have them a little earlier on in the semester, and to have more.
Yes. The seminar series helped me make decisions in choosing rotation labs.
Yes, very helpful to first years looking for labs. Also good for introducing students to labs they might have otherwise not been interested in.
